column4: Hey, I installed the latest Ubuntu 9.04, and everything works fine but the audio. According to the sound mixer I have an Intel HDA ALC888 and a ATI HDMI... neither work for audio. In WinXP, I have to download Realtek drivers because its a realtek HD audio device... please help?
you'll need to google for details, but you want to disable the ati hdmi audio
like i said you'll need to google for details
i don't have the machine that i did it with in front of me
rmmod
just use rmmmod
just rmmod
I'm new to Ubuntu, I dont know how to rmmod
sudo rmmod snd_hda_codec_atihdmi
lsmod, is it listed
no
lsmod and see if it's listed
its not listed
lsmod | grep ati, what is listed for sound
yah we already know that
its not even loaded as a module
it uses the same driver as hda_intel
can you suggest how to disable ati hdmi?
like i told you when you first asked the question, i did this on another machine and don't have the machine in front of me, so you'll have to google
ignore that, you need to fix the underlying problem before that dialog means anything
i am brand new to ubuntu and linux altogether. i do not know how to disable ati hdmi and i do not know what to search for on google.
